channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2024071835
item.description:
Report X-2024071835

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-25T15:13:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: GOODYEAR
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DESIGNATED RESPONDER, RESPONDED TO A CALL FOR DOOR 132 IN THE UNLOAD. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE IN FULL PPE AND WAS INFORMED BY THE UNLOADER OF THE LOCATION OF THE LEAKER. RESPONDER APPROACHED THE LEAKING PACKAGE TO DISCOVER THAT IT WAS A DECLARED HAZMAT. PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A SPILL TRAY, PLACED THE LEAKING HAZMAT ON SPILL CART, REMOVED ANY OTHER TAINTED PACKAGES, AND CLEANED THE SCENE ACCORDING TO HIS RESPONSE SHEET.

item.description:

  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ

  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THIS PACKAGE WAS UNLOAED LEAKING FROM BOX. PACKAGE WAS LEAKING FROM LID AND PLACE IN TO A HAZMAT BAG AND TOTE. I PLACE HAZMAT INTO A HAZMAT BAG AND INTO A HAZMAT DRUM. SHIPPERS NEED TO ENSURE THAT ALL LIDS ARE SEAL TIGHT BEFORE SHIPPING PACKAGES.
